discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct--MDA mode limits up to 2 mac addresses on interface each in a different vlan; PVID &VVID

Selected Answer: C
Multi-domain authentication host mode: you can authenticate two source MAC addresses, one in the voice VLAN and another one in the data VLAN. This is for the scenario where you have an IP phone and a PC on a single switchport. Any more source MAC addresses trigger a security violation.

choices.C: Cisco AnyConnect NAM and Cisco Access Control Server
choices.B: Cisco AnyConnect NAM and Cisco Identity Service Engine
choices.A: Cisco Secure Services Client and Cisco Access Control Server
choices.D: Windows Native Supplicant and Cisco Identity Service Engine

discussion.content: The answer to this question is really dependent on the software version of ISE. Pre 2.7 then the answer is Anyconnect NAM and Cisco ISE using EAP-FAST. If it is 2.7, 3.x then windows native supplicant and ISE using TEAP.
TEAP (enabling chaining via the windows native supplicant) is supported 2.7++ so this must be a very old question...

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Eap-channing (EAP-Fast) is a propietary protocol of CISCO , and that is why Cisco AnyConnect supplicant and cisco ISE can support eap-channing protocol

Selected Answer: B
B is correct- uses EAP-Fast. Windows supplicant does not support EAP-FAST. ACS is EOL & used for TACACS+ if still being used

B & D are both correct I think: "Previously, to achieve this you needed the Cisco AnyConnect NAM module and use EAP-FAST on the windows supplicant as the native Windows supplicant did not support this. Now, you can use the Windows Native Supplicant to perform EAP Chaining with ISE 2.7 with the use of TEAP."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/identity-services-engine/216510-eap-chaining-with-teap.html

questions.question_text: Which supplicant(s) and server(s) are capable of supporting EAP-CHAINING?

A network security engineer needs to configure 802.1X port authentication to allow a single host to be authenticated for data and another single host to be authenticated for voice.
Which command should the engineer run on the interface to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct-- MDA mode limits 2 mac on interface 1 in PVID & 1 in VVID

Selected Answer: A
Multi-domain authentication host mode: you can authenticate two source MAC addresses, one in the voice VLAN and another one in the data VLAN. This is for the scenario where you have an IP phone and a PC on a single switchport. Any more source MAC addresses trigger a security violation.

questions.question_text:
An administrator connects an HP printer to a dot1x enable port, but the printer is nor accessible.
Which feature must the administrator enable to access the printer?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct--MAB for printers is typical but they can use 802.1x. here it was not configured for 802.1x

choices.D: The groups are present but need to be manually typed as conditions.
choices.C: The groups are not added to Cisco ISE under the AD join point.
choices.B: Cisco ISE only sees the built-in groups, not user created ones.
choices.A: Cisco ISE's connection to the AD join point is failing.

discussion.content:
Had a bug in ISE 3.0 that allowed us to import the groups but they were not available for selection on Policies. 

Answer is however C.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct-- if you don't see the group listed, it was not imported

Selected Answer: C
We need to pick the AD group that we want to add to ISE.

questions.question_text:
When configuring an authorization policy, an administrator cannot see specific Active Directory groups present in their domain to be used as a policy condition.
However, other groups that are in the same domain are seen.
What is causing this issue?
